text: Statement of Work (SOW)
Between: Vizopay Limited T/AS Wiseflow (“Wiseflow” or “Service Provider”) and  DAC (“Elavon” or “Client”)
Effective Date: [Insert Date]

Relationship to Master Services Agreement (MSA):
This Statement of Work (“SOW”) is issued under, and subject to, the terms of the Master Services Agreement (“MSA”) between Wiseflow and Elavon, dated [Insert Date]. In the event of conflict, the MSA prevails unless explicitly stated otherwise in this SOW.
1. Project Overview

Wiseflow will provide Elavon’s Enterprise team with a business onboarding automation platform designed to reduce manual effort, streamline data entry, and improve accuracy, compliance, and customer experience. The solution digitises key onboarding steps, minimises duplication, and enhances operational efficiency.
2. Project Scope
This engagement covers delivery of a production-ready onboarding automation platform for Elavon’s Enterprise team, beginning with Marriott franchises as the initial rollout.
The platform will:
Automate key steps in the onboarding journey.
Support jurisdiction-specific onboarding flows (initially UK, Ireland, Germany, Poland, Norway, Sweden/Nordic region, and Spain).
Embed pre-risk screening, compliance, and regulatory checks.
Provide flexibility for Elavon to configure product catalogues, pricing rules, and organisational hierarchies.
Integrate third-party applications including Veriff (IDV), Creditsafe (business checks), and DocuSign (e-signatures).
The solution is designed for scalability, enabling expansion to Elavon’s wider hospitality and enterprise portfolio without duplication of effort or cost.
3. Scope of Work
Wiseflow will deliver the onboarding solution described above, automating key elements of Elavon’s process while allowing for necessary manual interventions.

Incorporated Technical Scope
The detailed technical requirements, configurations, and feature set for this engagement are described in “Elavon – Technology Scope (Final, dated [insert date])”, attached as Appendix A and incorporated into this SOW.
If there is any inconsistency:
the MSA governs over this SOW;
this SOW governs over Appendix A;
the Pricing & Payment Terms in this SOW govern over any pricing in Appendix A.
4. Platform Development & Customisation
Wiseflow will deliver:
Production-ready onboarding journeys for Marriott franchises, with jurisdiction-specific variations.
Automated capture, validation, and generation of application packs in Elavon’s required format.
DocuSign integration for digital contract execution.
Embedded compliance and risk checks, with flexibility for Elavon to select preferred data providers, in this case CreditSafe.
Delivery of completed application packs to Elavon for review and onward processing.
Configuration and management of product catalogue, pricing rules, and organisational hierarchies (as detailed in Appendix A).
5. Implementation & Deployment
Configuration of workflows based on Elavon’s specifications.
End-to-end and user acceptance testing (UAT).
Deployment of the hosted solution with agreed customisation.
6. Support & Maintenance
Post-deployment monitoring and troubleshooting.
Ongoing system updates and enhancements.
Issue resolution support.
7. Phased Rollout
The project will be delivered in phases:

Phase 1 – Marriott Initial Production Deployment (3–6 months): Implementation of the onboarding solution for Marriott franchises in a live production environment. This phase will run for three to six months, after which Elavon will determine timing for expansion.
Phase 2 – Hospitality Expansion: Rollout across Elavon’s wider hospitality sector clients, with refinements based on Marriott deployment learnings.
Phase 3 – Enterprise Expansion: Extension of the solution to Elavon’s broader enterprise client base.
8. Deliverables
Production-ready automated onboarding platform.
System configuration and workflow documentation.
Training sessions for Elavon’s team.
Continuous support and performance monitoring.
9. Timeline
Phase 1 – Marriott Initial Production Deployment: 3–6 months (dependent on Elavon’s decision on next-phase timing).
Phase 2 – Hospitality Expansion
Phase 3 – Enterprise Expansion
10. Pricing & Payment Terms
The commercial model combines a one-time implementation fee and a recurring subscription fee, with the detailed schedule in Appendix C – Pricing Schedule.
Implementation Fee: £25,000, covering configuration, deployment, and delivery of the platform described in Appendix A.

Subscription Fee: £15,000 per month. This fee includes platform access, core automation features, internal integrations (e.g., DocuSign, Veriff, Creditsafe), and ongoing support. It is based on Elavon’s current onboarding activity of approximately 847 applications per month and inclusively supports up to 1,000 applications per month without additional cost.
Usage and Add-Ons: Overage charges and optional services are detailed in Appendix C.
This structure provides a predictable monthly cost aligned to current volumes, with built-in headroom for growth.
11. Assumptions & Dependencies
Elavon will provide timely access to required teams and data sources.
Elavon will appoint a product sponsor with decision-making authority.
Timely feedback and approvals will be provided.
Changes in scope may affect timelines and costs.
12. Acceptance & Success Criteria

12.1 Functional Acceptance
The solution is deemed functionally accepted when:
Core onboarding journeys for Marriott are live in production and operate end-to-end as described in Appendix A;
UAT defects are resolved to Severity 3 or lower with agreed workarounds for any remaining issues; and
The workflow diagram in Appendix B is approved by both parties.

12.2 Performance & Service Acceptance
Operational performance during Phase 1 – Marriott Initial Production Deployment will be measured against the Success Criteria defined in Appendix D – Success Criteria & Performance Measurement (Phase 1).
Measurement period: within the Phase 1 operating window (3–6 months, ~10 applications per month).
Evidence: monthly performance reports issued by Wiseflow with KPI calculations and supporting logs/exports.
Data access: Elavon will provide timely access to data required to compute KPIs.

12.3 Exceptions
Metrics impacted by factors outside Wiseflow’s reasonable control (e.g., third-party provider outages, materially incomplete applicant data) will be excluded or fairly adjusted by mutual agreement.

12.4 Review & Remediation
If any Success Criterion is not met in a given month, the parties will agree a written remedial plan (owner, actions, target date) within 10 business days. Progress will be reviewed at the next monthly service review.

12.5 Contract Term Conversion (1-Year to 3-Year)
The initial term of this SOW is one (1) year from . If the Success Criteria in Appendix D – Success Criteria & Performance Measurement (Phase 1) are achieved for two consecutive calendar months within Phase 1, Elavon may, by written notice within 30 days of receipt of the second month’s performance report, elect to convert the term to three (3) years (the one-year committed period plus an additional two years). Fees remain as set out in Appendix C, unless varied by mutual written agreement.

12.6 Renewal
At the end of the three-year term, this SOW renews automatically for successive one-year periods unless either party provides 90 days’ written notice prior to a renewal date.
13. Confidentiality & Compliance
Both parties agree to maintain confidentiality and comply with all applicable regulatory and compliance requirements.
14. Signatures

For Wiseflow:
Name: Teresa Byrne
Title: Director
Date:

For Elavon:
Name:
Title:
Date:
Appendix
Appendix A – Technology Scope Document
Table of Contents
Elavon – Technology Scope	1
Scope overview	1
Configuration Settings	2
Customised Features	4
Third Party Applications	5
Recommended Setup	6
Pricing	8
Scope overview

Elavon Enterprise Team will be adopting the Wiseflow platform to deliver Phase 1 – Marriott Initial Production Deployment. This phase will operate in a live production environment and will form the basis for evaluating success criteria set out in Appendix D.

The purpose of Phase 1 is to design, configure, and deliver a production-ready onboarding solution that reflects the scope outlined below. While this initial phase is tailored specifically for Marriott hotels and their affiliates, we have also been informed of the broader requirements across Elavon’s Enterprise team and global business units.

Accordingly, all features, customizations’, integrations, and technology work carried out within this phase will be architected with scalability in mind—ensuring a streamlined future rollout across additional regions and minimising duplication of effort and cost.
Scope Areas:
Marriott-specific onboarding journey for the onboarding of Marriott hotels and affiliated entities.
Jurisdiction-specific flows (initially UK & EU markets, see table in configuration settings for full breakdown)
Rule-based logic for jurisdictional, regulatory, and compliance-driven decisioning.
Pre-risk screening embedded into the onboarding process to  compliance and operational efficiency.
Configuration Settings
The Wiseflow platform will be deployed and configured to meet Elavon’s security, compliance, and performance standards. The following baseline configuration settings will apply:
Setting
Description
Value
Multi-tenanted
Environment is multi-tenanted between jurisdictions.
Yes
VPC-isolated
Environment has isolated VPC instances for client.
Yes
Hosting-region(s)
The region(s) where instance, networks, database and application is hosted.
eu-west-2 (London)
ECS Deployment
Application and microservices are containerised and orchestrated via Amazon ECS (Fargate), enabling elastic scaling and resilience.
Enabled
Database (RDS)
Dedicated Amazon RDS (PostgreSQL) instance provisioned for Elavon to ensure performance, compliance, and data residency.
Provisioned with automated backups
Networking & Security
VPC-level isolation, private subnets, security groups, and network ACLs configured according to Wiseflow’s ISO 27001 and client compliance policies.
Configured per-client VPC
White-label Onboarding URL
Custom onboarding domain for Marriott phase 1.
https://flow.elavon.eu
Sandbox Environment URL
Separate UAT/sandbox environment for internal Elavon testing.
https://sandbox.elavon.wiseflow.ai
API Endpoint
Base API URL for programmatic access to onboarding services.
https://api.elavon.wiseflow.ai
Email Communications
Notification and transactional emails sent from branded Elavon domain.
flow@elavon.eu  (SPF/DKIM/DMARC applied)
Custom URLs
Additional URLs for environment separation and testing.
None.
High Availability
ECS + RDS deployed Multi-AZ with auto-scaling and failover.
Enabled across 3x AZs in eu-west-2
Monitoring & Logging
Application logs, ECS task metrics, RDS monitoring, and audit logs exposed via CloudWatch.
AWS CloudWatch dashboards + Wiseflow Admin Console
Jurisdictions
Form-specific country flows for customisation
Ireland, United Kingdom, Germany, Poland, Norway, Sweden / Nordic region, Spain
Data Retention Period
365 days
RBAC
As per Wiseflow’s standard configuration
Customised Features
Product Catalogue / Pricing Database
Development of a structured product catalogue and pricing database tailored to Elavon’s onboarding requirements.
Includes a custom administrative user interface that allows non-technical users to update, manage, and version control pricing rules and product details.
Supports jurisdictional variations (UK, France, Germany, etc.) to local compliance and flexibility in onboarding flows.
Org Chart Certification
Functionality to capture, display, and certify organisational hierarchies for onboarding entities.
verification of beneficial ownership, control structures, and compliance with KYC/KYB regulations.
Incorporates workflow steps for sign-off and approval, ensuring auditable governance across different jurisdictions.
Other Features
Additional features requested by Elavon outside the agreed phase 1 scope will be scoped, designed, and architected on demand
These will be quoted as a one-time capital expenditure, based on the estimated delivery effort (number of days x resources)
Day rate: £1,000 per resource per day.
A written estimate and approval will be provided in advance of commencing any such work to ensure alignment on scope, cost, and delivery timelines.
Third Party Applications
Veriff (managed by Wiseflow)
Integrated identity verification provider used for document and biometric checks.
Embedded into the onboarding flow to verify individuals in real-time, with results accessible through Wiseflow’s APIs.
Creditsafe (managed by Wiseflow)
Integration with Creditsafe for business credit checks and risk assessments.
Enables automated retrieval of company data, credit scores, and risk insights, which can be applied to decisioning rules within onboarding flows.
DocuSign (managed by Wiseflow)
Integration with DocuSign for electronic signatures on required compliance and contractual documents.
Supports pre-population of forms via Wiseflow’s API mapping, ensuring seamless end-to-end execution of agreements during onboarding.
Agreed Setup
Wiseflow recommends a hybrid managed service model for Elavon’s Marriott Phase. This balances Elavon’s need for customisation with the robustness of Wiseflow’s API-driven platform.
Hybrid Managed Service

A customised deployment, where Elavon receives a dedicated, white-labelled onboarding frontend asset integrated with a custom server layer. This server layer is built, hosted, and managed by Wiseflow on top of our core APIs, enabling full flexibility for Elavon-specific features while still leveraging our form builder and no-code tooling.
Benefits
Fully branded onboarding experience (https://flow.elavon.eu).
Custom features built and maintained by Wiseflow (e.g. product catalogue editor, org chart certification).
Dedicated managed service layer for maximum flexibility.
Enterprise-grade AWS hosting, security, and support.
Inclusions:
AWS Cloud Infrastructure setup (VPC, ECS, RDS, networking, security groups).
White-labelling and jurisdiction-specific configuration.
Initial onboarding flows (Marriott phase + UK, France, Germany).
MFA / SSO / SAML integration with Elavon’s IdP.
Custom features in scope.
Technical support and knowledge transfer during Phase 1 (Marriott).
Breakdown:
Configuration of AWS Cloud Infrastructure
Provisioning of isolated environments (VPC, ECS, RDS, networking, security groups) in eu-west-2.
Customisation Support (Standard)
White-labelling (URLs, email domains, branding) and jurisdiction-specific configuration.
Initial Flows Created
Design and implementation of the first set of onboarding flows (Marriott Marriot Phase + UK, France, Germany).
MFA / SSO / SAML Configuration
Integration with Elavon’s identity provider for enterprise authentication.
Support
Technical assistance and knowledge transfer during the phase 1 setup phase.
Custom Server Layer & Onboarding Asset
Build, host, and manage a dedicated server layer for Elavon.
Delivery of a custom, white-labelled onboarding frontend asset.
Integration with Wiseflow APIs for flexibility and bespoke functionality.
Custom Features In-Scope
Product catalogue/pricing database & editor.
Org chart certification.
Appendix B -  Workflow Diagram

A detailed visual representation of the onboarding workflow is provided in the attached diagram. This diagram illustrates the end-to-end automation process, including data collection, formatting, application pack generation, and contract signing via DocuSign.
Appendix C -  Pricing Details
A comprehensive breakdown of costs, including:
Feature
Pricing

Professional Services
Any services outside the scope of this SOW, including change requests or future phases not covered here, will require a separate Statement of Work. Where agreed, such services may be provided at a rate of £100 per day (ex VAT), unless otherwise agreed in writing.
Appendix D – Success Criteria & Performance Measurement (Phase 1)

heading.text: Appendix D – Success Criteria & Performance Measurement (Phase 1)

text:
Purpose
This appendix defines the measurable success criteria for Phase 1 – Marriott Initial Production Deployment. Achievement of these criteria will determine progression to Phase 2 and trigger Elavon’s option to extend the contract term from one (1) year to three (3) years, as set out in Section 12.5 of this SOW.

Measurement Period
Phase 1 will operate in a live production environment, processing approximately 10 Marriott applications per month. KPIs will be measured monthly throughout the Phase 1 deployment window (3–6 months). Two consecutive months of KPI achievement are required to trigger contract extension.

Success Criteria
During Phase 1 the following criteria must be achieved:

At least 10 Marriott applications per month successfully processed end-to-end using the platform, with data captured, validated, and generated into Elavon’s required application pack format without duplication.
A minimum of 60 percent of applications completed without manual rework.
No more than 5 percent of applications returned due to system or formatting errors.
System availability of 99.5 percent or higher during the measurement window, excluding scheduled maintenance.
All Severity 1 (critical) and Severity 2 (high) incidents resolved within the agreed SLA windows.

Evidence and Reporting
Wiseflow will provide a monthly performance report detailing KPI results, exceptions, and explanatory notes. Elavon will have access to dashboards and supporting data to verify reported metrics.

Exceptions
KPIs may be adjusted by mutual agreement if impacted by factors outside Wiseflow’s control, including third-party provider outages, upstream system failures, or materially incomplete or inaccurate applicant data.

Review and Remediation
Any KPI shortfall will trigger a joint remediation plan, agreed within 10 business days, specifying actions, owners, and target dates. KPIs are considered met once remediation actions are completed and verified in subsequent monthly reporting.
